content.prompt: The repetition of phrasing in “was excessively fond of his lady” and “were excessively fond of her too” in the second sentence of the passage is best described as a

choices.label: stylistic habit that distinguishes the narrator
shift in meaning that is humorously ironic
subtle distinction that highlights Mr. Barnaby’s inconsistencies

skill.text: Skill 4.C: Identify and describe details, diction, or syntax in a text that reveal a narrator's or speaker's perspective.
